embedReply.description:
[Ajouter ce bot √† ton serveur]({DISCORD_BOT_INVITE}) **|** [Website]({WEBSITE}) **|**   [Documentation](https://eduardozgz.gitbook.io/member-counter)

Pour avoir plus d'informations √† propos de cette commande, envoyer `{PREFIX}help` et le nom de la commande: ```
{PREFIX}help shortNumber```
**Info:** `()` signifie qu'un param√®tre est optionnel `[]` signifie qu'il est obligatoire

setup.helpDescription: Vous montre un guide d'utilisation du bot
setup.explanation:
**Merci d'avoir ajout√© Member Counter √† ton serveur!**
__**Cr√©er/√©diter un compteur**__
Pour cet exemple, nous allons utiliser `{members}`, qui compte le nombre total de membres dans votre serveur discord,mais vous trouverez plus de compteurs dans les pages suivantes
Vous pouvez placer ce compteur √† l'un des endroits suivants:

- Dans un salon **voix** **nom**
- Dans un salon **categorie** **nom**
- Dans un salon **texte** **sujet**
- Dans un salon**news** **sujet**

Maintenant, cr√©ez un nouveau canal, √©ditez-le et √©crivez `{members}` dans le nom ou le sujet, et cliquez sur 'enregistrer les modifications'

Vous pouvez √©galement ajouter plusieurs compteurs dans un nom/sujet, et les combiner avec votre propre contenu, voici un exemple:
```
{onlineMembers}/{members} Membres en ligne, {youtubeSubscribers:https://www.youtube.com/user/enyay} Abonn√©s!
{onlineMembersWithRole:614777997291028519,614816383053856769} Admins et mod√©rateurs sont en ligne!
```

> Si vous atteignez la limite de caract√®res lorsque vous √©ditez un nom/sujet, veuillez cocher `{PREFIX}help editChannel`
> Vous pouvez voir les configurations actuelles des compteurs avec `{PREFIX}seeSettings`, c'est utile pour ajouter des compteurs suppl√©mentaires sans d√©sactiver les pr√©c√©dents

__**Retirer un compteur**__
Dans un salon voix/nom de cat√©gorie:
Modifiez le nom du salon et √©crivez `{disable}` dans le nom, Member Counter le remplacera par un `‚úî`, cela signifie que vous avez supprim√© tous les compteurs de ce salon avec succ√®s

Dans un salon texte/news en sujet:
Il suffit de supprimer tout le sujet.

Vous pouvez √©galement supprimer le salon directement
setup.counters:
__**Counters**__
> You should enable the developer mode in Discord (User Settings > Appearence > Advanced > Developer Mode)
> To get an ID, right click in a channel/role and click "Copy ID"

> Those counters with an atherisk (\*) are premium counters, get more info in `{PREFIX}help upgradeServer`

- `{members}` Members in your server
* `{onlineMembers}` Online members in your server
* `{offlineMembers}` Offline members in your server
* `{users}` Users in your server (excludes bot)
* `{onlineUsers}` Online users in your server (excludes bot)
* `{offlineUsers}` Offline users in your server (excludes bot)
* `{bots}` Bots in your server (excludes normal users)
* `{onlineBots}` Online bots in your server (excludes normal users)
* `{offlineBots}` Offline bots in your server (excludes normal users)
- `{roles}` Roles in your server
- `{channels}` Channels in your server (excludes category channels)
* `{membersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID}` This counts how much members has a role or roles, write the roles IDs you wanna count after the `:`, and separate the role IDs with commas `,`
* `{onlineMembersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID}` Like `{membersWithRole:}` but only counts those members online
* `{offlineMembersWithRole:role1ID,role2ID}` Like `{membersWithRole:}` but only counts those members offline
* `{connectedMembers}` Total amount of connected members in the voice channels
- `{bannedMembers}` Amount of banned members in your server, the bot must have ban permissons to display this count
- `{http:url}` This will display the returned amount given by the response to the specified resource, the bot will perform a `GET` request and the server **must** reply with `the status code 200` and the `content-type: text/plain` Example: `{http:https://member-counter.eduardozgz.com/api/donation/count}`
* `{youtubeSubscribers:channelUrl}` Displays the youtube channel subscribers, replace channelUrl with the desired channel url
* `{youtubeViews:channelUrl}` Displays the youtube channel views
* `{twitchFollowers:channelName}` Displays the twitch channel followers, replace channelName with the desired channel name
* `{twitchViews:channelName}` Displays the twitch channel views

__**The following counters are of online players in a game server**__
Remember to replace `address` by the actual server address

- `{minecraft:address}` Minecraft
- `{source:address}` Any Source‚Ñ¢ based game or a game that uses the A2S protocol for querying stats (Counter Strike, Rust, Ark, Team Fortress 2, GMOD, etc)
- `{gtasa-mta:address}` Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas (Multi Theft Auto)
- `{gtasa-mp:address}` Grand Theft Auto: San Andreas (SA-MP)
- `{gta5-fivem:address}` Grand Theft Auto 5 (FiveM)

lockChannel.helpDescription:
You can use this commands to show a lockpad (üîí) instead of a speaker (üîä) in voice channels

**Usage**```{PREFIX}lockChannel [channel id]```
 **Example**```{PREFIX}lockChannel 700336568099143710```
lockChannel.success: Done! Now, **for non admin users**, the channel will be displayed with a üîí
lockChannel.errorInvalidChannel: You can only lock voice channels!
lockChannel.errorNoPerms: I can't edit the channel `{CHANNEL}` due to lack of permissions

editChannel.helpDescription:
If you are trying to set a counter but Discord tells you that you reached the name/topic length limit, you can use this command to "ignore" that limit
**Usage**```{PREFIX}editChannel [channelId] [content]
**Example**```{PREFIX}editChannel 701396983843127366 {onlinemembers} of {members} Online
editChannel.success: Done! You may have to wait a few seconds to see the new changes

setDigit.helpDescription:
You should see `{PREFIX}help topicCounter` before using this command.
Customizes numbers that will be displayed, the number argument must be a normal number, the second argument could be anything, like an emoji or a normal number with markdown.
If the first argument is the word "reset", the numbers will be restored to the default ones.

Usage: ```{PREFIX}setDigit reset
{PREFIX}setDigit [number] [your custom number]```
Example: ```{PREFIX}setDigit 3 **3**```
With the previous example every 3 will be shown as a bold **3**
setDigit.resetSuccess: Numbers restored to the default ones.

shortNumber.helpDescription:
This command allows you to show a count in a short form in counters placed in the name of a voice/category channel

**Usage**
```{PREFIX}shortNumber [enable/disable]```
**Examples**```{PREFIX}shortNumber enable
{PREFIX}shortNumber disable```
shortNumber.success: Done! You may have to wait a few seconds to see the new changes

prefix.helpDescription:
Changes the bot prefix.

Usage:```{PREFIX}prefix [new prefix]```

role.helpDescription:
You can allow or deny roles to use bot administrative commands.
You can use ``all`` keyword to allow or deny all roles.
To see which roles are currently allowed use `{PREFIX}seeSettings`
```{PREFIX}role allow @Mod
{PREFIX}role allow @Mod @OtherRole
{PREFIX}role deny all```
role.errorNoRolesToUpdate: You must mention at least 1 role

seeSettings.helpDescription: Shows all bot settings for this server.

settingsMessage.allowedRolesText: Allowed roles to use administrative commands:
settingsMessage.warningNoPermsText: \‚ö†Ô∏è = The bot cannot continue updating this channel due to lack of permissions

resetSettings.helpDescription: Restores the custom settings of this server to the default ones

update.helpDescription: If you think the counters are stuck use this command to update them again.
update.inProgress: Updating the counters, this may take a while.

upgradeServer.helpDescription: This command allows you to invite Member Counter Premium, to use this command you must have a premium account, which you can get by donating at least 5 USD: `{PREFIX}donate`.
upgradeServer.success:
Done! The next step is invite the premium bot:
{BOT_LINK}
upgradeServer.noPremiumAccount: You must have a premium account.
upgradeServer.errorCannotUpgrade: You can't upgrade the server because it already has premium.
upgradeServer.noServerUpgradesAvailable: You can't do more server upgrades because you don't have more server upgrades available, you can check how much you have left with `{PREFIX}profile` or get more with `{PREFIX}donate`

lang.helpDescription: Changes the bot language for this server, you must have administrator permissions to run this command.
